Dear Ms. Trotter:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action. Please note that
violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP and your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. If I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please
contact the local office at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,

ALLEGATIONS:
On the evening of 8/15/21, it was alleged Staff 1 was facetiming with her boyfriend at
work. Staff 1 allegedly made Youth J touch staff 1's breasts while facetiming him.
Staff 1 also showed Youth J a photo of her boyfriend's penis.
INVESTIGATION:
These allegations were reported to Van Buren Township law enforcement. Shortly
after allegations were received, Youth J was psychiatrically hospitalized for weeks.
She was replaced in a foster home and AWOLed from the foster home around
9/21/21. As of 10/14/21, her whereabouts were still unknown.
Interviews
I interviewed Staff 1, age 22, jointly with Government Worker 1 on 8/17/21. She has
worked at the facility for two months. On 8/15/21, Staff 1 worked a double shift and
supervised four youth alone from 7am – 11pm. She said Youth J was “on watch”
due to self-harm. Being “on watch” means the youth must stay near staff during
waking hours and leave her bedroom door open while sleeping.
Staff 1 was asked if she used her personal cell phone at work on 8/15/21. She said
she was outdoors with Youth J when she answered a facetime call from her sister.
Staff 1 denied having a “boyfriend” or facetiming with anyone else that day. She
voluntarily showed us her call history. Her phone showed one 5-minute call to a
contact with a female name who Staff 1 identified as her sister.
Government Worker 1 read the current allegations aloud to Staff 1. Regarding
facetiming her boyfriend, Staff 1 denied talking to any male on 8/15/21. She
clarified, “I do have a best friend (a male pseudonym in her contacts). Youth J has
3

asked to call him twice…Youth J asked his real name and I said (his first
name)…She has never communicated with him, ever.”
Staff 1 was asked if she had any explicit photos on her phone. She was unsure.
She was asked if she showed Youth J a photo of any male’s penis, to which she
answered “No.”
Staff 1 was asked if she touched Youth J’s breasts or had Youth J touch her breasts
inside or outside of the clothes. Staff 1 appeared shocked and denied touching
Youth J’s breast. She said it was possible she accidently “brushed against” the
youth when she “may’ve gone into Youth J’s room to unlock her closet.”
I interviewed Youth G, age 17, jointly with Government Worker 1. On 8/15/21, she
said she was away from the facility working until 8pm. When she returned, Youth J
told Youth G that Staff 1 “was being really weird.” Youth J told her that Staff 1
unlocked her closet and made Youth J touch her “boob.” At one point, Youth G saw
Staff 1 and Youth J outside in the parking lot. “I heard a man on the (Staff 1’s)
phone. They were out there 10 – 15 minutes plus in the front office for a while too.
Youth J came and told me Staff 1’s boyfriend showed her “his thing” (penis).”
I interviewed Youth C, age 17, jointly with Government Worker 1. After 8pm, she
said Staff 1 was with Youth J in the front office, then they went outside. “We (Youths
C and G) could hear someone on the phone…Youth J told me later that she was
scared. That Staff 1 showed her pictures and videos of her boyfriend and made her
touch her. Staff 1 unlocked Youth J’s closet and was touching her and making her
lift her shirt. Staff 1 had taken pictures of Youth J on her phone. Staff 1 took other
pictures of Youth J a few days before.”
Youth J was hospitalized just after this allegation was received. She was moved to
a foster home and AWOLed around 9/21/2021. As of 10/14/21, Youth J remains on
AWOL status. Therefore, a forensic interview could not be scheduled. If Youth A
becomes available for interview in the future, an addendum to this report will be
completed.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
qualifications.
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
4

(b) Experience to perform the duties of the position
assigned.
ANALYSIS: Youth J is on AWOL status and unavailable for interview.
Until they are both forensically interviewed by law enforcement,
it cannot be determined if former Staff 1 will be criminally
charged and/or deemed unsuitable to work with children in the
future. However, at this time there is insufficient evidence of a
rule violation as Staff 1 denied the allegations and her phone did
not support a call to a male during the time identified. If Youth A
becomes available for interview in the future, an addendum to
this report will be completed.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDING:
During this investigation, Staff 1 said she and Youth J went outdoors on 8/15/21 to
take photos while three youths remained in the building. Chief Administrator 1 (CA
1) confirmed that higher level youth are allowed to be in the building together
unsupervised.
Staff 1 said Youth J asked her to go outdoors to take photos of her hoping Staff 1
would have the photos printed and give them to Youth J for her own use. Staff 1
willingly allowed us to view the photos she had taken of Youth J. There were 45
photos – most showed Youth J posing (all fully clothed), and some were selfies of
Staff 1 and Youth J posing together. Timestamps on the photos showed they were
taken from 1:47pm – 2:20pm.
I reviewed Girlstown’s policy #250 Standards of Conduct which indicates staff shall
not take pictures of clients for the staff’s personal use.
After interviewing Staff 1, Government Worker and I met with CA 1 and Program
Manager 1. Their plan was to notify Staff 1 that she was being placed on
administrative leave pending the outcome of this investigation. I asked them to
make sure all of the photos that were taken of Youth J were deleted from Staff 1’s
phone prior to placing the staff on leave.
CA 1 and Program Manager 1 met with Staff 1 and assured that all photos of Youth
J were deleted. Once Staff 1 learned that she was being placed on leave, CA 1 said
she immediately resigned.
5

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4109 Program statement.
(1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
program statement which specifically addresses all the
following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission,
care, safety, and supervision, methods for addressing
residents' needs, implementation of treatment plans, and
discharge of residents.
ANALYSIS: Staff 1 had 45 photos of Youth J on her phone. Agency policy
indicates staff shall not take photos of youth.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Once an acceptable corrective action plan is received, I recommend this facility
continue its current licensing status.
